attributes.title: stay far far away
attributes.review:
i, like so many other fellow americans, am trying to find hope in this crazy world. i thought that maybe, just maybe, if i gave this guy a chance, my life would turn around for the better. and let me tell you, that did NOT happen.
i downloaded this app, and suddenly started to feel light headed... “that’s strange,” i thought, “have i drank enough water today?” i set my phone down on my bed next to me and tried to stand, using my nightstand for some more support. i got to my feet after what seemed like hours and immediately blacked out.
i finally awoke to the feel of rough concrete against my cheek, and the gritty taste of dirt in my mouth. my body was aching and sore, i felt like i couldn’t move. i struggled to put an arm underneath me to try and push myself up, spitting the dirt and sand out of my mouth.
i lifted my head to try and get my bearings, and what i saw absolutely terrified me.
police, armed to the teeth, lined the street that i lay on. trump banners hung from every building balcony that stood behind them. the more i looked, the more bodies i saw... but not just police.
citizens. i couldn’t count how many people i saw lying dead in the street. mothers who tried to rescue their sons gunned down by police. fathers who were trying to provide for their families. EMTs working the front lines during a worldwide pandemic. innocent people.
a million images and stories of these people’s lives flashed through my head as i tried to count the bodies i saw. i lost count, as i started violently vomiting on the ground in front of me.
when it finally stopped, i tried once again to push myself up, at least enough so that i could crawl, get away, get out of the street. i got up on both elbows, and as soon as i reached one hand out to start moving, the boot of an officer came crashing down between my shoulder blades. my head smacked into the concrete, and i was out like a light.

NO JUSTICE NO PEACE. BLACK LIVES MATTER.
